originalText.text:
My favorite NYC Nail Salon for the past 5 years.
The manicure quality is one of the best in the city which is hard to find. They use natural products which again is important.
Love the owner and great manicurists.

text.text:
My favorite NYC Nail Salon for the past 5 years.
The manicure quality is one of the best in the city which is hard to find. They use natural products which again is important.
Love the owner and great manicurists.

originalText.text:
Great salon, had a pedicure and manicure there on separate occasions by two different people. They're NOT aggressive with the nails, not over filing, or cutting too much off when trimming cuticles, which is very rare to find these days. Nails looked lovely, and have lasted over two weeks with not one chip. I also got a foot massage the times I went it, one of the best I've ever had.

If I lived in NY this would be my regular, but when I'm down again I will be sure to book an appointment again. Highly recommend.

text.text:

If I lived in NY this would be my regular, but when I'm down again I will be sure to book an appointment again. Highly recommend.

originalText.text: Absolutely in LOVE with this cute little salon. Feels like an oasis as soon as you enter. The manicure is very relaxing and the technicians are most thorough. The nail polish application is perfect. The only thing that could be improved is maybe the gel formulation and the variety of shades. As compared to other salons, their gel polish chips relatively soon. They do have a lot of different shades, but perhaps it’s just me - I would have liked more shades of quirky colors like lime, lemon, teal, electric orange/blue, etc.

text.text: Absolutely in LOVE with this cute little salon. Feels like an oasis as soon as you enter. The manicure is very relaxing and the technicians are most thorough. The nail polish application is perfect. The only thing that could be improved is maybe the gel formulation and the variety of shades. They do have a lot of different shades, but perhaps it’s just me - I would have liked more shades of quirky colors like lime, lemon, teal, electric orange/blue, etc.

originalText.text: Got a gel mani and 20-min massage so I could use up a gift card from friends in one go. They were out of my first two selections of colors which was frustrating so ended up with my third choice. I was expecting the massage to be in a separate room or at least in a massage chair but it was in the same chair as where I had my nails done which was uncomfortable. It’s been two days and now the gel is already chipping which I have never had happen before at other salons. Staff were super nice but otherwise this was a very disappointing experience.

originalText.text:
Loved! Loved! Loved this hidden gem found in the East Village. In the last year I've been really honing in on receiving non-toxic gel manicures. I definitely see the difference in my overall health and of course the wellness and growth of my nails and skin by using non-toxic products.

And yes I am crazy to go all the way in the city to get my nails done. But my typical place did not have any open appointments and so I googled them and they were able to see me same day within an hour and a half. Katrina, who is the manager of the nail salon was absolutely accommodating, professional and yet friendly. The place is impeccably clean and I love the exposed brick and plants creating that ambiance vibe while having your nails done.

I took notice of the high class products used and loved how detail oriented my nail technician was from filing to cutting my nails to cutting my cuticles to actually applying the nail polish.

In all of my years having manicures in the last 25 years, this is the first place that applies not only oil to your cuticles but also a very soothing oil-based hand lotion and did not wipe it down with a hot towel. Lol. I never knew the reasoning behind adding lotion to your hands and then removing the lotion with the hot towel. I will definitely be coming back!
